subject: JUnit4TestAdapter issue when using the IntelliJ IDEA 4 testrunner

messageBody:
Hi,
The following test works fine on Eclipse with the old style jUnit 3
testrunner, but when run with IntelliJ IDEA version 4's testrunner it
blows up with a ClassCastException. Can
anyone give advice on how to resolve this, as the official IDE at my
workplace is IntelliJ IDEA version 4, and this will slow jUnit 4.4
adoption :-(

---------------------------------
public class UnderTest {
public boolean tickleIt() {
return true;
}
}
----------------------------------
import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
import junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter;

import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.Test;

public class TestUnderTest extends UnderTest { // can now insert test
Spy or self shunt

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(TestUnderTest.class);
}

@Before
public void setUp() {
// no-op
}

@Test
public void testTickleIt() {
assertTrue(tickleIt());
}
}


Many Thanks,
Chris
